metadata.titleEn: Thunderstorm cloud characteristic data set in China and surrounding areas (2010-2018)
metadata.description: This data set is based on the lightning location data calculation of TBB products, cloud classification (CLC) products and world wide lightning location network (wwlln) in the full disk area detected by fy-2e satellite (fy-2e) from 2010 to 2018 to establish the lightning storm cloud feature data set. The algorithm used for wwlln lightning clustering is DBSCAN algorithm. According to Hutchins et al. (2014), it is required that the number of lightning in each lightning cluster in the thunderstorm cloud is greater than 2 and all fall within the radius of 12 km. The data set includes thunderstorm cloud time and location information, thunderstorm cloud shape (long, short axis, rotation angle, etc.) information represented by fitting ellipse, cloud area representing thunderstorm cloud structure, statistical value of black body temperature (TBB), included flash information, and included strong convection core, lightning cluster information and other data information.
metadata.instructions:
File naming: it is stored in the structure data format of mat format data. The file name is "yyyymmdd_hhmm.mat", and yyyymmddhhmm respectively represents the time corresponding to the data (universal time, UTC): year, month, day, hour, minute, for example, 20100112_ 0000 means 0:00 on January 12, 2010.
Data reading method: the format of data file is mat file, which is a standard binary file and the standard format of MATLAB data storage. When reading data, you can directly use matlab to read. Some codes for data reading are as follows:
%Reading of single parameter
filepath=’\dataset\YYYY\YYYYMMDD_ hhmm. mat’;% Data path
load(path);% Open the data file
Area=TSC(1). Area；% Read the area of the first thunderstorm cloud
WWLLN_ lon=TSC(1). WWLLNstroke(:,8); % Read the longitude information of all lightning in the first thunderstorm cloud
S52_ Area=TSC(1). S52(2). Area; % Read the area of the first strong convection core in the first thunderstorm cloud

Feature Specification.Question: What specific attributes are used to characterize the morphology of thunderstorm clouds in a dataset?
Feature Specification.Answer: time and location information, shape represented by a fitted ellipse, long and short axes, rotation angle, cloud area, statistical values of equivalent black body brightness temperature, lightning information, strong convection cores, lightning clusters

Interpretation.Question: How can clustering algorithms, such as DBSCAN, contribute to the understanding of lightning patterns within thunderstorm clouds in satellite and lightning network data?
Interpretation.Answer: Clustering algorithms like DBSCAN help identify and group lightning events into clusters based on their proximity, ensuring that each cluster contains more than two lightning strikes within a radius of 12 km. This method allows researchers to infer characteristics of the thunderstorm clouds, such as their spatial distribution and density of lightning activities, which can reveal insights into the structure and dynamics of thunderstorms over time.

Causal Antecedent.Question: What factors contribute to the challenges in forming accurate thunderstorm cloud feature datasets using satellite and lightning location data?
Causal Antecedent.Answer: The challenges in forming accurate thunderstorm cloud feature datasets using satellite and lightning location data arise from the need to integrate different data sources, such as TBB products from FY-2E satellites and lightning location data from WWLLN, and the complexity of using algorithms like DBSCAN for clustering lightning data. These processes must ensure that each lightning cluster within a thunderstorm cloud contains more than two lightning events within a 12 km radius, which requires precise and consistent data collection and processing methods.

Goal Orientation.Question: What is the primary objective of developing a dataset that characterizes thunderstorm clouds using satellite TBB products, cloud classification data, and global lightning location network data?
Goal Orientation.Answer: The primary objective is to establish a comprehensive thunderstorm cloud characteristics dataset by utilizing TBB products from the FY-2E satellite, cloud classification products, and lightning location data from the World Wide Lightning Location Network. This aims to provide detailed information on thunderstorm cloud features such as time, location, morphology, structure, and lightning information, which can enhance understanding and analysis of thunderstorm dynamics in China and surrounding regions from 2010 to 2018.

Instrumental/Procedural.Question: What procedural techniques can be used to cluster lightning data when building a dataset of thunderstorm cloud characteristics for a region?
Instrumental/Procedural.Answer: The DBSCAN algorithm is used for clustering lightning data, with the requirement that each lightning cluster contains more than 2 lightning strikes, all located within a 12 km radius.
